text: Molecular mechanisms of anoxia / reoxygenation - induced neutrophil adherence to cultured endothelial cells .

The objectives of this study were to ( 1 ) determine the time course of neutrophil adhesion to monolayers of human umbilical vein endothelial cells ( HUVECs ) that were exposed to 60 minutes of anoxia followed by 30 to 600 minutes of reoxygenation and ( 2 ) define the mechanisms responsible for both the early ( minutes ) and late ( hours ) hyperadhesivity of postanoxic HUVECs to human neutrophils .

The results clearly demonstrate that anoxia / reoxygenation ( A / R ) leads to a biphasic increase in neutrophil adhesion to HUVECs , with peak responses occurring at 30 minutes ( phase 1 ) and 240 minutes ( phase 2 ) after reoxygenation .
Oxypurinol and <extra_id_0> catalase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited phase-1 adhesion , suggesting a role for <extra_id_0> xanthine oxidase <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and H2O2 .
In comparison , platelet activating factor ( PAF ) contributed to both phases of neutrophil adhesion .

Anti - <extra_id_0> intercellular adhesion molecule-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and anti - <extra_id_0> P-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> antibodies ( monoclonal antibodies [ mAbs ] ) attenuated phase-1 neutrophil adhesion , consistent with roles for constitutively expressed <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and enhanced surface expression of preformed <extra_id_0> P-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

text: Phase-2 neutrophil adhesion was attenuated by an anti - <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mAb , indicating a dominant role of this adhesion molecule in the late phase response .

Pretreatment with actinomycin D and cycloheximide or with competing ds-oligonucleotides containing the nuclear factor-kappa B or <extra_id_0> activator protein-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> cognate DNA sequences significantly attenuated phase-2 response , suggesting a role for de novo macromolecule synthesis .

Surface expression of <extra_id_0> ICAM-1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , <extra_id_0> P-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and <extra_id_0> E-selectin <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on HUVECs correlated with the phase-1 and -2 neutrophil adhesion responses .

text: Collectively , these findings indicate that A / R elicits a two-phase neutrophil-endothelial cell adhesion response that involves transcription - independent and transcription - dependent surface expression of different endothelial cell adhesion molecules .
